title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 09 September 2013 - XWiki
content:

04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:21 <cjd> has quit  
05:22 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
06:26 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
06:56 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:06 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:47 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:50 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
07:53 <polx> has quit  
07:53 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:09 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:54 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <vmassol> good morning  
10:36 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: hi, we need to apply your PRs today, what's the status?  
10:36 <gdelhumeau> hi vmassol  
10:36 <gdelhumeau> I'm correcting them  
10:36 <vmassol> ok  
10:38 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <mkresse> has left #xwiki  
10:56 <vmassol> guys, wdyt about sending pings or not for SNAPSHOT versions (for active installs)?  
10:56 <vmassol> I'm hesitating  
10:56 <vmassol> it could be interesting to have that info to know how many use snapshot instances too no?  
10:56 <vmassol> I'm leaning towards sending ping data for all instance versions  
10:57 <vmassol> (we can always filter in the query to display data if we want)  
11:05 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes filtering is easy if you send the version  
11:07 <vmassol> actually tmortagne I'm currently only sending extension versions, do we also have some "instance version" to send?  
11:07 <vmassol> (I think you have that in the EM/DW, no?)  
11:08 <vmassol> xwiki.getVersion()?  
11:08 <tmortagne> what do you call "extension version" ?  
11:09 <vmassol> this.extensionRepository.getInstalledExtensions()...extension.getId().getVersion().toString()  
11:09 <vmassol> you can also check at http://extensions.xwiki.org/activeinstalls/\_search?size=5&pretty=true  
11:10 <tmortagne> xwiki.getVersion() is a bit risky since people usually change it to add more information about the instance like which cluster is it and things like this, you can ask the distribution module for the distribution extension  
11:10 <vmassol> ok do we need this or is what I'm doing enough?  
11:10 <tmortagne> vmassol: I know what is an extension version but what extension are you talking about ?  
11:10 <vmassol> all extensions  
11:10 <vmassol> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/activeinstalls/\_search?size=5&pretty=true  
11:11 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/152 corrected  
11:11 <vmassol> all returned by this.extensionRepository.getInstalledExtensions()  
11:11 <tmortagne> so it's not "extension" but "extensions'  
11:11 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: ok, will look at it in a few seconds  
11:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: in English you don't put plural there :)  
11:11 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: and I think you can also merge https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/148 if Edy does not say -1  
11:12 <vmassol> "I'm currently only sending extension versions" and not  
11:12 <vmassol> "I'm currently only sending extensions versions"  
11:12 <vmassol> :)  
11:12 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: ok will check too  
11:13 <tmortagne> the disribution is not an installed extensoin  
11:13 <tmortagne> the installed extensions are the one installed with EM  
11:13 <vmassol> yep  
11:13 <tmortagne> like core extensions  
11:13 <vmassol> there's xwiki-enterprise-ui though  
11:13 <vmassol> which might be enough no?  
11:13 <tmortagne> there is the ui if the user does not skip DW  
11:14 <tmortagne> sending the distribution version would be safer  
11:14 <vmassol> ok, I need to check how to get it  
11:14 <vmassol> I'll check for a distribution SS  
11:14 <tmortagne> no need to send all the core extensions I guess  
11:15 <tmortagne> org.xwiki.extension.distribution.internal.DistributionManager (yes internal for now, it's only used by DW right now and we are not full happy with it yet to make it public)  
11:15 <vmassol> ok  
11:16 <vmassol> I don't see the api  
11:16 <vmassol> which method is it?  
11:16 <vmassol> getWikiUIExtensionId?  
11:16 <tmortagne> getDistributionExtension  
11:16 <tmortagne> not the UI  
11:16 <tmortagne> you don't want the UI  
11:16 <vmassol> ok  
11:19 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <vmassol> tmortagne: can getDistributionExtension() return a null or am I guaranteed that it's always non null?  
11:26 <tmortagne> it can can return null but it means it's a distribution that does not expose any information  
11:27 <vmassol> ok I'll handle null then  
11:38 <evalica> has quit  
12:14 <camil7> vmassol: for the english translation of "platform.extension.distributionWizard.uiStepDescription"  I see you have replaced the typo "fuctionality" by "features" ... not sure if this is intentional  
12:17 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:17 <evalica> has quit  
12:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:29 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> has joined #xwiki  
12:29 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:29 <vmassol> camil7: yep it was intentional  
12:29 <vmassol> you don't think it's correct?  
12:30 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> Hi, I am having problems removing the top menu bar if the user is not an admin. Im looking in menuview.vm but not sure what to edit  
12:30 <polx\_> has quit  
12:30 <camil7> ah ok, then all is well. I just wondered ...  
12:30 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:31 <polx> has quit  
12:31 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
12:32 <camil7> xwikiorg\_guest\_5: what part of the top menu should be removed ?  
12:35 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> All of it, even the logout  
12:35 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> As we just want the data to be viewable by users  
12:36 <camil7> um, but then it is not much of use for a wiki at all (?)  
12:37 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> We still want to use the spaces and be able to input data.  
12:37 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> We still also want the export and more actions bar  
12:38 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> We just want to lock certain users to a certain space and not display them the top bar  
12:38 <camil7> anyway, you can add a '#if ($isAdmin)' at the start and a '#end' at the end of the menuview.vm, and it should be gone for all but admins  
12:39 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> Is menuview.vm just the top bar?  
12:42 <camil7> it is the complete <div id="mainmenu">, annd nothing else  
12:45 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> That code has removed the bar for everyone, including admins  
12:46 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> If admins are set via the admin group  
12:47 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> Do we need to use "$user.isUserInGroup('panel:XWiki.XWikiAdminGroup')"  
12:52 <camil7> you should be able to check the '$hasAdmin'  variable, which is set up in  xwikivars.vm for that reason  
12:53 <camil7> and just in case you end up in some pace where you do not have this variable, better use   $xwiki.hasAccessLevel('admin')   then checking for group membership  
12:53 <camil7> (just in case the user has admin rights without being in the AdminGroup of the current wiki)  
12:54 <camil7> ah, I see I made a typo above:    should have been   '#if ($hasAdmin)'  ... not $isAdmin , sorry  
12:55 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> Oh np, that last one worked anyway! :)  
13:20 <mflorea> has quit  
13:34 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> has quit  
13:41 <vmassol> sburjan: can you check if http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XINFRA-67 is fixed and close it if it is? thanks  
13:41 <sburjan> vmassol: checking on 5.1 M1  
13:41 <sburjan> 5.2 M1  
13:41 <vmassol> thx  
13:42 <sburjan> vmassol: seems fixed. you can close it  
13:45 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: anything more to apply?  
13:49 <polx> has quit  
13:49 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
13:53 <polx> has quit  
13:53 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:56 <vmassol> tmortagne: could you check the wikistream quality profile build, it seems to be failing? Thanks  
13:56 <vmassol> (wiki stream - XML)  
13:56 <vmassol> whenever I commit I get an error as a result ;)  
13:56 <vmassol> (and I don't know if my commit is ok or not re qualirt)  
13:56 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <vmassol> \*quality  
13:59 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> has joined #xwiki  
13:59 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Is it possible to limit search to a certain space? As users are limited to one space only the search function breaks as it defaults to xwiki.  
14:00 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> defaults to main even  
14:05 <vmassol> xwikiorg\_guest\_4 (would be nice to use a better nick btw ;)): yes you can, for example: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Search?text=rr&space=Main  
14:06 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Hi, I logged in through the web and diddnt change :)  
14:06 <vmassol> example on xwiki.org  
14:06 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> So how can I limit the default search bar to a space?  
14:06 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Search?&text=eee&f\_space\_exact=Main  
14:07 <vmassol> you'll need to pass the extra query string parameter for that or modify the search page  
14:07 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> But the default search is still going through "view/Main/Search". Normal users wont be able to access main just a specific space  
14:08 <vmassol> the page to modify depends on the search you're using: lucene, solr, etc  
14:08 <vmassol> the other solution is through rights  
14:08 <vmassol> just don't allow your user to view some spaces and they won't show in the results  
14:09 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> That doesnt work, as if i Restrict them from viewing the main space a search result returns" Error You are not allowed to view this document or perform this action."  
14:09 <vmassol> yes of course you cannot restrict the space where the search is!  
14:09 <vmassol> :)  
14:10 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> But I just want to search, for example "space1"  
14:10 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Where most of my content is  
14:10 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> But when Im on that space and do a space it defaults to main  
14:11 <vmassol> as I said  
14:11 <vmassol> 2 solutions  
14:11 <vmassol> see above  
14:11 <vmassol> (but rights is the only solution that will really prevent users from viewing some spaces)  
14:13 <camil7> I guess workspaces might be better than "normal spaces" for that use case  
14:13 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Even when I pass an extra parameter, the search is still defaulting through the "main" space. No natter what I do  
14:13 <vmassol> camil7: indeed good idea  
14:13 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Which is a space I dont want normal users to view.  
14:14 <camil7> you can give view rights on single pages, too, i.e. the Search pages  
14:14 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Oh right  
14:14 <camil7> then users can see that single page, but not the rest of the space  
14:14 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> That would be useful  
14:14 <vmassol> xwikiorg\_guest\_4: you didn't mention which search engine you're using  
14:15 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Sorry vmassol, its the default one whichever that is. Im new to xwiki so again apologies  
14:15 <camil7> but maybe checking out the workspaces app would be really better - that one creates separate wikis instead of spaces, and every wiki has its own search  
14:15 <vmassol> the default one depends which version of xwiki you're using :)  
14:16 <vmassol> go to the admin , click on Search  
14:16 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Lucene I think  
14:17 <vmassol> ok then the whole ui for the lucene search is in Main.LuceneSearch  
14:17 <vmassol> you can edit that page and customize it  
14:17 <vmassol> to only search in a given space or change whatever else you wish  
14:18 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Workspaces is something we will definately need to look into. We're currently just demo'ing xwiki and checking what we can/cant do. We're migrating over from moinmoin  
14:18 <vmassol> BTW I highly recommend you upgrade your version of xwiki and use SOLR as the default search engine  
14:19 <vmassol> it's much better  
14:19 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Ok, this was installed a few months ago and is just a test wiki for now  
14:21 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Where is main.lucenesearch located?  
14:22 <vmassol> Main space, LuceneSearch document  
14:22 <vmassol> it's probably hidden so you need to set your user to view hidden docs  
14:23 <vmassol> xwikiorg\_guest\_4: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/PageEditing#HAdvancedMode  
14:26 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Ok found hidden docs thanks  
14:33 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> I have show hidden documents enabled, but I still cannot see lucene search on the main space  
14:33 <vmassol> press ctrl+G anywhere  
14:33 <vmassol> and type "LuceneSearch"  
14:33 <vmassol> or go to the index page  
14:33 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Thats a handy command  
14:33 <vmassol> (top level wiki menu, "Document Index")  
14:41 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Apologies for the constant questions but how can I set rights to an individual page (i.e the search page)  
14:48 <camil7> go to that page and use "Edit" -> Permissions"  
14:48 <camil7> er ... its called "Access rights", not "Permissions" sorry  
16:05 <msmeria> has quit  
16:10 <sburjan> vmassol: how will the old sub-wiki system called from now on ?  
16:11 <sburjan> since both workspaces and subwiki are now called subwiki  
16:13 <evalica> has quit  
16:13 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:13 <polx\_> has quit  
16:14 <vmassol> sburjan: wikis not subwiki :)  
16:14 <vmassol> they will be merged in 5.3  
16:14 <vmassol> FTM there's workspaces and wiki-manager  
16:16 <polx> has quit  
16:16 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:19 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> has quit  
16:21 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
16:21 <sburjan> vmassol: so basically we will have one feature offering the two types ? wikis and sub-wikis  ?  
16:21 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: it seems the build is broken on ci.xwiki.org since "XWIKI-8820: Introduce framework to stream wiki data from one representation to another"  
16:21 <vmassol> there's no subwiki  
16:23 <sburjan> vmassol: by subwiki I mean the old style of XEM. The Main wiki with separate sub-wikis  
16:23 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: looking thanks  
16:25 <Mariah> has joined #xwiki  
16:27 <tmortagne> raa git filter on "target" package again...  
16:27 <tmortagne> fixing it  
16:29 <tmortagne> there should not be any target package lft  
16:29 <tmortagne> left
